home.title: Hi, I'm Julio Reyes
home.subtitle: DevOps Engineer specialized in CI/CD automation and AWS Cloud. Based in Chile and collaborating with teams in the United States, helping improve delivery pipelines, automate deployments, and build secure, reliable and reproducible infrastructure using IaC.

about.title: About Me
about.body: I'm a DevOps Engineer with over 4 years of experience working with companies in the United States (banking, enterprise platforms, and SaaS). I focus on automating processes, improving delivery workflows, and deploying efficient, secure and scalable cloud environments using DevOps best practices, containers and Terraform.

skills.title: Main Skills
skills.item1: CI/CD Pipelines with Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Tekton, TeamCity, and AWS CodePipeline.
skills.item2: AWS Cloud: Lambda, S3, EC2, CloudFront, API Gateway, DynamoDB, EKS/ECS.
skills.item3: Infrastructure as Code with Terraform and CloudFormation.
skills.item4: Containers & Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift.
skills.item5: Automation with Python and Bash for complex workflows and internal tooling.
skills.item6: Git & DevOps Practices: branching models, hooks, quality gates, and security scanning.

projects.title: Projects
projects.platformBody: Complete automation of delivery pipelines from development to production: static code analysis, Docker packaging, deployments on Kubernetes/OpenShift, integration with quality gates and approval workflows. Reduced deployment times by 40‚Äì60%.
projects.serverlessBody: Automated pipelines for Lambda functions with testing, versioning, aliases and branch-based deployments. Faster and more reliable delivery with no manual steps.
projects.portfolioBody: Full AWS infrastructure defined with Terraform: private S3 bucket with OAC, CloudFront with HTTPS (ACM), custom domain on Route 53, and automatic deployment via CodeBuild on every push.

cicd.title: CI/CD Demo
cicd.body1: This demo shows a real CI/CD pipeline implemented on AWS. Every GitHub push triggers CodeBuild, which rebuilds and publishes the site to a private S3 bucket.
cicd.body2: CloudFront uses an Origin Access Control (OAC) to securely access the bucket and deliver the website over global HTTPS caching.
cicd.body3: The entire infrastructure is managed with Terraform to ensure reproducibility and Infrastructure-as-Code best practices.
